intro: Chaetothylax cuspidatus, commonly known as the spiny bladder nut, is a perennial herb native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Its fruit is a dry, two-lobed capsule that contains several seeds. The plant is often found in grassy areas and is adapted to dry, well-drained soils.
